title: Search for Patent Prior Art
description: Before filing a patent application, a patent agent needs to search for 'prior art' to assess the novelty of an invention.

tasks.description: Review the invention disclosure to understand the key features of the new invention.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent identifies the core concepts of the invention.

tasks.description: Develop a search strategy with relevant keywords and class codes.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a comprehensive search plan.

tasks.description: Search patent databases (like USPTO, Espacenet) and other technical literature for existing inventions that are similar.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent retrieves a list of potentially relevant prior art references.

tasks.description: Analyze the found prior art and write a report on the patentability of the new invention.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent provides an opinion on whether the invention is likely to be patentable.
